name: PCI Card Production and Provisioning Logical Security 3.0.1
description: The PCI Card Production and Provisioning Logical Security Requirements 3.0.1 define the minimum logical security requirements for vendors involved in the production and provisioning of payment cards and similar devices.

controls.control: Roles and Responsibilities
Information Security Personnel

The vendor must designate, in writing, a senior manager with adequate security knowledge to be responsible for the vendor’s Information Security Management and security of the cloud-based provisioning platform. These requirements refer to this person as the “Chief Information Security Officer” (“CISO”).

testingProcedures.description: Interview the CISO to determine their understanding of their roles and responsibilities.

Examine applicable policies and procedures to verify that a senior manager has been designated as CISO and has IT security knowledge and responsibility of IT security management and cloud-based provisioning platform.

controls.control: The CISO must be an employee of the vendor.

testingProcedures.description: Examine employment documentation to verify employment and position.

controls.control: The CISO must, on a monthly basis, report to executive management the current status of security compliance and issues that pose potentials risks to the organization.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented processes and verify reports or meeting minutes to ensure that monthly security compliance status or issues that pose potential risks are being reported by CISO to executive management.

controls.control: Assignment of Security Duties
The CISO must:
Be responsible for compliance to these requirements.

testingProcedures.description: Interview the CISO and examine documentation to determine scope of responsibility.

controls.control: Have sufficient authority to enforce the requirements of this document.

testingProcedures.description: Examine applicable policies and procedures to verify that a senior manager has been designated as CISO and has IT security knowledge and responsibility of IT security management and cloud-based provisioning platform.

controls.control: Not perform activities that he or she has the responsibility for approving.

testingProcedures.description: Examine logs or similar documentation to confirm the CISO does not perform activities related to the approval process for the vendor’s Information Security Management and security of the cloud-based provisioning platform for which they have responsibility for approving.

controls.control: Designate a backup person who is empowered to act upon critical security events in the event the CISO is not available.

testingProcedures.description: Interview the backup person to determine his or her understanding of his or her roles and responsibilities.
Examine documentation that identifies the designated backup person who is empowered to act upon critical security events in the absence of the CISO.

controls.control: Identify an IT Security Manager (if not themselves) responsible for overseeing the vendor’s security environment.

testingProcedures.description: Interview the CISO and examine documentation to conclude the individual or an appropriate designee has responsibility the vendor security environment.

controls.control: The back-up CISO and the IT Security Manager must be employees of the vendor.

testingProcedures.description: Examine employment documentation to verify employment and position.
Interview the back-up CISO to verify role.

controls.control: When the CISO backup is functioning on behalf of the CISO, the backup must not perform activities for which they have approval responsibility and must not approve activities that they previously performed.

testingProcedures.description: Examine logs or similar documentation to confirm the backup CISO does not perform activities related to the approval process for the vendor’s Information Security Management and security of the cloud-based provisioning platform for which they have approval responsibility.

controls.control: Where managers have security compliance responsibilities, the activities for which the manager has responsibility must be clearly defined.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documentation to authenticate the manager’s security roles and responsibilities are clearly defined.

controls.control: Staff responsible for day-to-day production activities must not be assigned security compliance assessment responsibility for the production activities that they perform.

testingProcedures.description: Interview security personnel or examine documentation—e.g., reviewing accounts on personalization machines and in the production workflow—to determine independence exists between day-to-day production operations and personnel performing security compliance assessments for those same production activities.

controls.control: Security Policy and Procedures
Information Security Policy
The vendor must define and document an information security policy (ISP) for the facility and disseminate to all relevant personnel (including vendors, sub-contractors, and business partners).

testingProcedures.description: Interview a sample of relevant personnel to verify they are aware of the policy and that they have access to it.
Examine the information security policy and verify that the policy is published.

controls.control: Senior management must review and endorse the validity of the ISP at least once each year.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence—e.g., formal sign-off—that the information security policy has been reviewed and endorsed by senior management within the most recent 12-month period.

controls.control: The ISP must include a named individual assigned as the “policy owner” and be responsible for management and enforcement of that policy.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine the ISP to verify that:

  • The information security policy designates a specific policy owner by name.

  • The policy owner is responsible for management and enforcement of that policy.

Interview the policy owner to verify that the policy owner:

  • Has acknowledged his or her responsibility.

  • Ensures that the policy is updated and changes communicated as needed.

controls.control: The vendor must maintain audit trails to demonstrate that the ISP and all updates are communicated and received by relevant staff. Evidence of staff review and acceptance of ISP must be maintained.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine audit trails to verify they exist and:

  • ISP updates are communicated to relevant staff.

  • Evidence of staff reviews and acceptance is maintained—e.g., automated systems for policy disbursement.
Interview a sample of staff to ensure that they are aware of the current ISP.

controls.control: Security Procedures
The vendor must maintain procedures for each function associated with the ISP to support compliance with these requirements.

testingProcedures.description: Examine procedural documents to ensure procedures have been defined for each function described in the ISP—e.g., password policy, remote access policy.

controls.control: Procedures must be documented and followed to support compliance with these Security Requirements. The security procedures must be reviewed, validated, and where necessary updated annually.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence that the procedures are reviewed, validated, and where necessary, updated annually.
Interview a sample of staff to determine that procedures are followed to support compliance with these Security Requirements.

controls.control: Security procedures must describe the groups, roles, and responsibilities for all activities that protect cardholder data.

testingProcedures.description: Examine policies to verify that they clearly define information security responsibilities for all personnel.
Interview a sample of responsible personnel to verify they understand the security policies.

controls.control: Incident Response Plans and Forensics
Have a documented incident response plan (IRP) for known or suspected compromise of any classified data. The IRP must be communicated to relevant parties.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to determine that the IRP is communicated to relevant parties.
Examine the incident response plan and related procedures to verify the entity has a documented IRP addressing known or suspected compromise of any classified data.

controls.control: Ensure staff report any unexpected or unusual activity relating to production equipment and operations.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence of existence of reported incidents.
Interview staff to determine that they report any unexpected or unusual activity relating to production equipment and operations.

controls.control:
Within 24 hours, report in writing any known or suspected compromise of confidential or secret data to the Vendor Program Administrator (VPA) and the impacted issuers. Confirmed incidences must be reported to appropriate law enforcement agencies upon confirmation.

The written communication must contain information regarding the loss or theft including but not limited to the following information:

  • Name of issuer

  • Type of data

  • Name and address of the vendor

  • Identification of the source of the data

  • Description of the incident including:

    • Date and time of incident

    • Details of companies and persons involved

    • Details of the investigation

    • Name, e-mail, and telephone number of the person reporting the loss or theft

    • Name, e-mail, and telephone number of the person to contact for additional information (if different from the person reporting the incident)

testingProcedures.description: Examine ISP documentation to verify notification procedures for suspected compromise of confidential or secret data to the VPA and impacted issuers are in place and requires reporting within 24 hours.
Examine reported incidences to verify that law enforcement agencies were included in the written notification. Each notification must include at minimum the information outlined in Requirement 3.3c.

controls.control: Investigate the incident and provide at least weekly updates about investigation progress.

testingProcedures.description: Examine written notifications to determine weekly updates were issued during the investigation process.

controls.control: Supply a final incident report providing the investigation results and any remediation.

testingProcedures.description: Examine reports to determine a final report was provided and that the report contains results and any remediation.

controls.control: Identify and preserve specific logs, documents, equipment, and other relevant items that provide evidence for forensic analysis.

testingProcedures.description: Examine incident response procedures to identify what logs, documents, equipment, or other relevant information is being preserved. Validate identified information is being preserved.

controls.control: Data Security
controls.description: The data security requirements in this and embedded sections apply to confidential and secret data. The vendor must maintain detailed procedures relating to each activity in this section.

controls.control: Classifications
controls.description:
Definitions

Secret Data

Information assets classified as secret require additional measures to guard against unauthorized use or disclosure that would result in significant business harm or legal exposure. This classification is typically used for highly sensitive business or technical information. Secret data is data that, if known to any individual, would result in risks of widespread compromise of financial assets.

All symmetric (e.g., Triple DES, AES) and private asymmetric keys (e.g., RSA)—except keys used only for encryption of cardholder data—are secret data and must be managed in accordance with Section 7 of this document, “Key Management: Secret Data.”

Examples:

  • Chip personalization keys

  • PIN keys and keys used to generate CVVs, CVCs, CAVs, or CSCs

  • PINs

Confidential Data

Confidential data is considered any information that might provide the vendor with a competitive advantage or could cause business harm or legal exposure if the information is used or disclosed without restriction. Confidential data is data restricted to authorized individuals. This includes cardholder data and the keys used to encrypt cardholder data.

Examples:

  • PAN, expiry, service code, cardholder name, Track 2 or Track 2 equivalent

  • TLS keys

  • Vendor evidence preserving data

  • Authentication credentials for requesting tokens

  • Mobile Station International Subscriber Directory Number (number used to identify a mobile phone number)

Unrestricted/Public Data

Unrestricted/public data includes any data not defined in the above terms—i.e., information that is developed and ready for public dissemination, including any information that has been explicitly approved by management for release to the public. Controls are out of scope of these requirements and may be defined by the vendor.

controls.control: Protection Controls
Documented security requirements must exist that define the protection controls commensurate to the classification scheme.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documentation to verify that data-protection controls are documented, and that the data-classification scheme differentiates between secret, confidential, and public data.

controls.control: All payment data must have an identifiable owner who is responsible for classification for ensuring protection controls are implemented and working.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documentation to verify that data ownership identification is included in the data-protection controls.
Examine a sample of stored data to verify that the data owner and security classification are identifiable.

controls.control: Encryption
controls.description: All secret and confidential data must be:

controls.control: Encrypted using algorithms and key sizes as stated in Normative Annex A.

testingProcedures.description: Examine key-management policies and procedures to verify that cryptographic keys used for secret and confidential data use algorithms and keys sizes that are in accordance with Annex A.

Examine evidence for a sample of keys to verify that the key algorithms (select at least one asymmetric and one symmetric) and sizes used for secret and confidential data conform to the values defined in Annex A.

controls.control: Encrypted at all times during transmission and storage.

testingProcedures.description: Examine transmission channels and data storage areas to verify that encryption is enabled and operating effectively for secret and confidential data.
Interview personnel to identify controls in place for the transmission and storage of secret and confidential data.

controls.control: Decrypted for the minimum time required for data preparation and personalization.

testingProcedures.description: Examine data flow and storage documentation and other supporting evidence to verify secret and confidential data is encrypted during storage and only decrypted for the minimum time needed to prepare data for personalization and perform personalization.

controls.control: The vendor must only decrypt or translate cardholder data on the data-preparation or personalization or cloud-based provisioning network and not while it is on an Internet- or public facing network.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine documentation that describes the data flow to verify secret and confidential cardholder data:

  • Is decrypted only on the data-preparation, personalization, or cloud-based provisioning systems.

  • Is never decrypted while the data is on an Internet- or public-facing network.

  • Remains encrypted in the DMZ. Additional validation and assurance can be provided through checking the DMZ network for decryption/encryption software.

controls.control: Access to Cardholder Data
Document and follow procedures describing the vendor’s data access requirements.

testingProcedures.description: Observe a demonstration showing authorized access to cardholder data and that access attempted by an unauthorized user is declined.
Examine documentation to verify that the cardholder data access policy and procedure are documented.

controls.control: Prevent direct access to cardholder data from outside the cloud-based provisioning network or the personalization network.

testingProcedures.description: Examine access-control settings to verify cardholder data cannot be accessed from outside the cloud-based provisioning and personalization networks and systems.

controls.control: Prevent logical access from outside the high security area (HSA) to the data-preparation or personalization networks.

testingProcedures.description: Examine access-control settings to verify logical access to the data preparation and personalization networks is prevented from outside the high security area (HSA).

controls.control: Ensure that access is on a need-to-know basis and that an individual is granted no more than sufficient access to perform his or her job.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine a sample of access-control settings to verify that:

  • The access rights for the individual are known.

  • The reason for the access permission is available and access is justified.

  • The individual does not have access permissions beyond those sufficient to perform his or her job.

controls.control: Establish proper user authentication prior to access.

testingProcedures.description: Observe a demonstration of the user authentication process to verify it conforms to procedures and provides confidence that the user was authenticated.
Examine documentation to determine whether user authentication procedures are defined.

controls.control: Make certain that access audit trails are produced that provide sufficient details to identify the cardholder data accessed and the individual user accessing the data.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of audit trails to verify they exist for individual access to cardholder data and provide sufficient detail to identify the individual user.

controls.control: Ensure that PANs are masked when displayed or printed unless there is a written issuer authorization. When PANs are masked, only a maximum of the first six and last four digits of the PAN can be visible. Business requirements must be documented and approved by the issuer.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence to verify that when a PAN is not masked the issuer has authorized the visible PAN and that the business justification is documented.
Examine evidence that PANS are masked such that only the first six and last four digits are visible when displayed or printed.

controls.control:
Apply appropriate measures to ensure that any third-party access meets the following requirements:

  • Third-party access to cardholder or cloud-based provisioning data must be based on a formal contract referencing applicable security policies and standards.

  • Access to cardholder or cloud-based provisioning data and the processing facilities must not be provided until the appropriate access controls have been implemented and a contract defining terms for access has been signed.

testingProcedures.description:
For all third-party service providers that have access to cardholder or provisioning data:

  • Examine evidence that a formal contract with the service provider exists and that it includes identification of and compliance with the applicable security policies and standards.

  • Examine evidence to verify that access to cardholder and cloud-based provisioning data is not provided until a formal contract defining access terms is signed.

controls.control: Ensure that only authorized database administrators have the ability to directly access cardholder or cloud-based provisioning databases. Other user access and user queries must be through programmatic methods.

testingProcedures.description: Examine database-access policies and procedures to verify that only authorized database administrators are granted direct access to cardholder or cloud-based provisioning databases while all other access is controlled through programmatic processes.

Examine a sample of access-control settings to verify that only authorized database administrators are granted direct access to cardholder or cloud-based provisioning databases while all other access is controlled through programmatic processes.

controls.control: Ensure that direct access to databases is restricted to authorized database administrators. Systems logs for database administrator access must exist and be reviewed weekly.

testingProcedures.description: Observe a demonstration that direct access to data contained in databases is limited to authorized database administrators.
Examine evidence that data access activity logs exist and that the logs are reviewed at least weekly.

controls.control: Ensure that application (program) IDs used for cloud-based processes are used only for their intended purposes and not for individual user access.

testingProcedures.description: Observe a demonstration to verify that application IDs used for cloud-based processes cannot be used for individual user access.
Examine evidence to verify that application IDs for cloud-based processes cannot be used for individual user access and the IDs can only be used for their intended purpose.

controls.control: Transmission of Cardholder Data
controls.description: The requirements in this section apply to data transmitted to or from the issuer or authorized processor.

controls.control:
Cardholder data transmission procedures must incorporate the maintenance of a transmission audit log that includes, at a minimum:

  • Date and time of transmission

  • Identification of the data source

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of cardholder data transmission logs to verify they exist and at a minimum contain the date/time of transmission and identification of the data source.

controls.control: Cardholder data transmitted to or received from an external source or transferred on the cloud-based provisioning network must be encrypted and decrypted per the encryption requirements of this document.

testingProcedures.description: Interview DBAs to identify where cardholder data is encrypted and decrypted when transmitted to or received from an external source or transferred on the cloud-based provisioning network.

Examine network and/or data-flow diagrams or other evidentiary documentation to verify that provisioning cardholder data transmitted to / received from an external source is only encrypted/decrypted as per the encryption requirements in this document—e.g., encryption strengths, algorithms, locations, durations, etc.

controls.control: The vendor must establish mechanisms that ensure the authenticity and validate the integrity of cardholder data transmitted and received.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify that upon transmission or receipt the cardholder data authentication and validation process complies with the defined procedure.
Examine policies and procedures to verify that cardholder data transmitted and received is authenticated and validated.

controls.control: The vendor must protect the integrity of cardholder data against modification and deletion at all times.

testingProcedures.description: Examine procedures and the production data flow to verify that cardholder data integrity is protected against modification and deletion.

controls.control: The vendor must accept cardholder data only from pre-authorized sources that are defined and documented.

testingProcedures.description: Examine data transmission logs to verify that cardholder data is received from and sent only to pre-authorized locations.
Examine documentation to verify that authorized cardholder data sources are defined.

controls.control: The vendor must log and inform the card brands of all issuers sending the vendor cardholder data in clear text.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence to verify that any identified clear-text cardholder sent by an issuer was reported to the VPA.
Examine policy and procedure documentation to verify a process is in place to identify clear-text cardholder data sent by an issuer and report it to the VPA.

controls.control: If the file is not successfully transmitted, or only part of the cardholder data is received, the recipient must contact the sender to resolve. The vendor must inform the issuer or authorized processor upon discovery that the file was not successfully received. Any incomplete cardholder data transmission received must be deleted under dual control and logged accordingly.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine documentation to verify the vendor has procedures to:

  • Resolve cardholder data transmission errors.

  • Notify the issuer or authorized processor upon discovery that the file was not successfully received.

  • Delete under dual control and log any incomplete cardholder data transmissions.

controls.control: Retention and Deletion of Cardholder Data
Ensure that procedures that define the vendor’s data-retention policy are documented and followed.

testingProcedures.description: Examine policies and procedures to verify that a data-retention policy exists.
Examine evidence that the retention policy is followed.

controls.control:
Delete cardholder data within 30 days of the date the card file is personalized unless the issuer has authorized longer retention in writing.

  • Ensure that the authorized retention period does not exceed six months from the date the card is personalized.

  • Ensure each issuer authorization to retain cardholder data is valid for no longer than two years.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine a sample of cardholder data authorized for retention longer than 30 days and verify that:

  • Cardholder data is deleted in compliance with the authorized retention period.

  • Cardholder data is not retained longer than the six-month maximum.
Examine issuer authorization that allows for cardholder data retention longer than 30 days to verify that the authorization is less than two years old.
Examine evidence of issuer authorization for personalization data retained longer than 30 days after personalization.

Examine a sample of retained cardholder data to verify that it is not retained longer than 30 days after personalization unless the issuer has authorized longer retention in writing. Verification of data deletion must include any data backups and return files in the DMZ that contain cardholder data.

controls.control: Delete data on the personalization machine as soon as the job is completed.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of completed batches to verify that cardholder data is deleted from the personalized machine once the job is completed.

controls.control: Confirm the deletion of manually deleted cardholder data including sign-off by a second authorized person.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence for a sample to verify that any cardholder data manually deleted was deleted with sign-off by an authorized secondary party.

controls.control: Conduct quarterly audits to ensure that all cardholder data beyond the data retention period has been deleted.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence for a sample to verify that quarterly audits were conducted to ensure all cardholder data was deleted if it was retained beyond its authorized retention period.

controls.control: Ensure that all cardholder data has been irrecoverably removed before the media is used for any other purpose.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence for a sample to verify that all cardholder data was irrecoverably removed before the media was used for another purpose.

controls.control: Ensure media destruction is performed under CCTV surveillance according to industry standards (see ISO 9564-1: Personal Identification Number Management and Security) under dual control, and that a log is maintained and signed confirming the destruction process.

testingProcedures.description:
Observe CCTV recordings for an example to verify that:

  • Media is destroyed in accordance with industry standards and under dual control; and a

  • log is maintained and signed confirming the destruction process.

controls.control: Ensure cardholder data is always stored within the high security area (HSA).

testingProcedures.description: Examine the data storage policy and procedures to verify cardholder data is being stored within the designated high security area.
Observe the cardholder data storage location to verify it is a high security area.

controls.control:
Ensure that cardholder data retained for longer than 30 days after personalization complies with the following additional requirements.

This data must:

i. Be removed from the active production environment.

ii. Be stored on a separate server or media

iii. Be accessible only under dual control.

testingProcedures.description:
Observe the cardholder data storage area utilized for data retained longer than 30 days after personalization to verify that the data:

  • Is removed from the active production environment.

  • Is stored on a separate server or media.

  • Can only be accessed under dual control.

controls.control: Media Handling
The vendor must have a documented removable-media policy that includes laptops, mobile devices, and removable storage devices—e.g., USB devices, tapes, and disks.

testingProcedures.description: Examine the vendor’s policies and procedures for removable media documentation to verify it exists and includes devices such as laptops, mobile devices, USB devices, tapes, and disks.

controls.control: All removable media—e.g., USB devices, tapes, disks—within the HSA must be clearly labeled with a unique identifier and the data classification.

testingProcedures.description: Observe a sample of removable media within the HSA to verify it is clearly labeled with a unique identifier and data classification.

controls.control: All removable media must be securely stored, controlled, and tracked.

testingProcedures.description: Observe the removable media storage location to verify the area is secure.
Examine the removable media check-in/out process to verify an audit trail is maintained and that it provides an accurate record of media possession.

controls.control: All removable media within the HSA or the cloud-based provisioning environment must be in the custody of an authorized individual, and that individual must not have the ability to decrypt any sensitive or confidential data contained on that media.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine a sample of checked-out, removable media within the HSA or the cloud-based provisioning environment to verify:

  • The media is in the custody of the person to whom the media was issued.

  • The individual is authorized to possess the media.

  • That individual does not have the ability to decrypt any sensitive or confidential data contained on that media other than in compliance with procedures for handling sensitive or confidential data.

  • The media does not contain clear-text confidential data.

controls.control:
A log must be maintained when media is removed from or returned to its storage location or transferred to the custody of another individual. The log must contain:

  • Unique identifier

  • Date and time

  • Name and signature of current custodian

  • Name and signature of custodian recipient

  • Reason for transfer

testingProcedures.description:
Examine the media audit trail documentation to verify that it contains at least the following data points:

  • Unique media identifier

  • Date and time logged out and returned

  • Name and signature of the current custodian

  • Name and signature of custodian recipient

  • Reason for transfer

controls.control: Transfers of custody between two individuals must be authorized and logged.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence that any transfer of checked out media is authorized and logged.

controls.control: Transfer of removable media to and from the HSA must be authorized and logged.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of media that was removed from the HSA to verify that the removal was authorized and logged.

controls.control: Physically destroy any media holding secret or confidential data when it is not possible to delete the data so that it is no longer recoverable.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence that media containing secret or confidential media is destroyed in a manner that makes it impossible to recover the data.

controls.control: Contactless Personalization
controls.description:
The security requirements for dual-interface cards that are personalized using the contact interface are the same as for any other chip card. The requirements in this section apply to personalization of chip cards via the contactless NFC interface.

The vendor must:

controls.control: Ensure personalization signals cannot be detected beyond the HSA.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence to verify testing was performed showing that contactless personalization signals cannot be detected external to the HSA.

controls.control: Conduct a scan of area surrounding the HSA whenever the personalization environment is changed to confirm personalization data sent by wireless communication does not reach beyond the HSA.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine evidence to verify that testing for personalization signals outside the HSA was performed after the last significant change to the personalization environment. Significant changes include but are not limited to:

  • The introduction of new personalization equipment

  • Modification of personalization equipment shielding

  • Structural changes to the HSA perimeter

controls.control: Ensure that when personalization signals are encrypted, they comply with the encryption standards defined in Normative Annex A. If the signals are encrypted, 4.7 a, b, and d herein do not apply.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence that encrypted personalization signals comply with the encryption requirements defined in Normative Annex A.

controls.control: Perform a manual or automated inspection of the secure personalization area at least twice each month in order to detect any rogue radio-frequency (RF) devices.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence that manual or automated scans for rogue RF devices are performed at least twice per month.

controls.control: Ensure that personalized cards (including rejects) are stored and handled as batches of two or more cards or enclosed within protective packaging that restricts reading card emissions until the cards are packaged for final distribution or destruction.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine evidence to verify personalized contactless cards are stored and handled:

  • As batches of two or more cards, or

  • Enclosed within protective packaging that restricts reading card emissions

controls.control: Data Used for Testing
Test (non-production) keys and test (non-production) data cannot be used with production equipment.

testingProcedures.description: Observe the location of the test environment to verify that it is separate from production.
Interview personnel to verify testing is performed using test keys, data, equipment, and environment.
Examine documented policies and procedures to verity test keys and test data are restricted from use in production.

controls.control: Cards used for final system validation or user acceptance that use production keys and/or data must be produced using production equipment.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence to verify cards using production keys were produced for final system validation and user-acceptance testing in the production environment using production equipment.

controls.control: Mobile Provisioning Activity Logs
The vendor must maintain an electronic log for both when cards are successfully and unsuccessfully provisioned. The log must be maintained for a minimum of 45 days.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence that provisioning activity logs are retained for at least 45 days.
Examine a sample of electronic logs to verify that successful and unsuccessful provisioning activity is logged.

controls.control: Decommissioning Plan
The vendor must document its policies and procedures by which assets associated with card production and provisioning activities are secured in the event production activities are terminated.

testingProcedures.description: Examine policies and procedures to verify that there is a decommissioning plan by which assets associated with card production and provisioning activities are secured in the event production activities are discontinued.

controls.control: The procedures must identify all data storage, card design materials, cards, card components, physical keys, cryptographic keys, and hardware utilized for production activities that must be secured.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine the decommissioning plan to verify it includes the process by which the following items, at a minimum, are secured:

  • Cardholder data

  • Card design materials

  • Cryptographic keys

  • Production hardware

  • Physical keys

controls.control: The disposition expectations for each identified item must be defined. For example, items may be returned to the owner, transported to an authorized user, or destroyed.

testingProcedures.description: Examine the decommissioning plan to verify that the disposition expectation is defined for each item covered in the plan.

controls.control: Network Security
Typical Vendor Network
controls.description:
The requirements in this section do not apply to vendors that only perform key management or pre-personalization activities on a stand-alone wired system (not connected to any network) and do not perform data preparation or personalization within their facilities.

See Appendix B, “Topology Examples,” for network examples.

Definitions

Issuer/Data Source

This is the issuer that owns the cardholder data or that sends it to the vendor on behalf of the issuer.

Private Network (Leased lines), Internet, POTS

Cardholder data is typically sent over these three main types of network to the personalization vendor.

Data Preparation Network

This is the network that contains the server(s) where the cardholder data is stored pending personalization. This is also the network where the data is prepared and sent to the production floor.

Personalization Network

This is the network that contains the card personalization machines.

controls.control: Card Production and Provisioning DMZ
The DMZ must be dedicated to card production/provisioning activities.

testingProcedures.description: Examine network diagrams and system configurations to verify that a DMZ dedicated to card production/provisioning activities is established.

controls.control: The card production and provisioning network must be segregated from other parts of an organization's network.

testingProcedures.description: Examine network diagrams and system configurations to verify that card production and provisioning network(s) are segregated from other parts of an organization's network.

controls.control: All connections to and from the personalization network must be through a system in the DMZ.

testingProcedures.description: Examine network diagram to verify all communication to and from the personalization network is exchanged via a system in the DMZ.

controls.control: The DMZ must be located in the server room of the HSA.

testingProcedures.description: Observe the system components comprising the DMZ to verify it is located in the server room within the HSA.

controls.control: DMZ infrastructure equipment located within the HSA server room must be in a dedicated rack with access restricted to the minimum number of authorized individuals.

testingProcedures.description: Observe the DMZ system components to verify they are located in dedicated rack(s) capable of restricting individual access.

Examine policies and procedures regarding access to the dedicated rack(s) and verify the list of individuals with access is restricted to the minimum number of individuals required for effective operations.

controls.control: All switches and cabling associated with the DMZ equipment must be stored within the same rack with only the minimum required number of cable connections entering/exiting the rack in order to provide connectivity to firewalls.

testingProcedures.description: Observe DMZ switches and cabling to verify they are all stored within the same rack.
Observe the DMZ cable connections to verify that only the minimum number of cable connections required to provide connectivity to firewalls are entering/exiting the rack.

controls.control: Mobile Provisioning Networks
HCE provisioning must be on its own network, but SE based provisioning is not required to be separated from other personalization networks.

testingProcedures.description: Examine logical configuration settings—e.g., firewall rules—to verify segmentation.
Examine network diagrams to verify that the HCE provisioning system is separated from other personalization network systems.

controls.control: General Requirements
Maintain a current network topology diagram that includes all system components on the network. The diagram must clearly define the boundaries of all networks.

testingProcedures.description: Examine network topology diagram to verify it exists, clearly defines the boundaries for all networks, and includes all system components that reside in the HSA.

controls.control: Ensure the network topology diagram is reviewed, updated as appropriate, and verified at least once each year and whenever the network configuration is changed.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence that the network topology diagram was reviewed and updated when the network configuration was changed and at least within the last 12 months if there were no changes.
Interview network administration personnel to verify the policy and procedures require topology review and update upon making changes to the network and at least annually.

controls.control: Ensure that the CISO accepts, by formal signature, the security implications of the current network topology.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence that the CISO has accepted the security implications of the current network topology and that the document includes his or her formal signature.

controls.control: Document the flow of cardholder and cloud-based provisioning data within the environment from its receipt/generation to end of its lifecycle. The diagram(s) are kept current and updated as needed upon changes to the environment and must undergo an overall review for accuracy at least every 12 months.

testingProcedures.description: Examine the cardholder and cloud-based provisioning data-flow diagram to verify that cardholder data flows across systems and networks from its receipt/generation to end of its lifecycle.
Interview the IT Manager to verify the diagram(s) are kept current and updated as needed and that it undergoes an overall review for accuracy at least every 12 months.

controls.control: Ensure that the personalization and data-preparation systems are on dedicated network(s) independent of the back office—e.g., accounting, human resources, etc.—and Internet-connected networks. A virtual LAN (VLAN) is not considered a separate network.

testingProcedures.description: Examine network configurations to verify personalization and data-preparation systems are on dedicated network(s) independent of the back office—e.g., through the use of a firewall(s) and not a VLAN between the personalization/data-preparation systems and the back office and Internet-connected networks.

controls.control: Physically and logically segment systems and applications that make up the cloud-based provisioning network from other vendor networks and Internet-connected networks. For example, in a traditional card vendor environment this could be a separate rack in a server room, or in a provisioning-only entity, housed in a separate room or cage in a data center. It cannot be in the same rack as other servers used for different purposes.

testingProcedures.description: Observe where the cloud-based provisioning network components are housed to verify they are separate from other vendor networks and Internet-connected networks. For example, they cannot be in the same rack as other servers used for different purposes.
Examine network diagrams and other relevant materials to verify that any cloud-based provisioning network is physically and logically segmented from the broader environment.

controls.control: Put controls in place to restrict, prevent, and detect unauthorized access to the cloud-based and personalization networks. Access from within the high security area to anything other than the personalization or cloud-based networks must be “read-only”.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of access rules to verify that access from within the high security area to anything other than the personalization or cloud-based networks is “read-only.”

Examine policies and procedures to verify that:

  • Access to the cloud-based and personalization networks is restricted, and unauthorized access is prevented and detected.

  • Access from within the high security area to anything other than the personalization or cloud-based networks is “read-only.”

controls.control: Be able to immediately assess the impact if any of its critical connecting points are compromised.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented incident response procedures to verify processes are in place that allow for immediate assessment of the impact of any compromise of critical connecting points.

controls.control: Have controls in place to restrict “write” permission to any system external to the personalization network to only pre-approved functions that have been authorized by the VPA, except for systems in the dedicated DMZ. These write functions must not transmit cardholder data if this involves direct write from the system containing the information.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine system configurations to verify that:

  • “Write” permissions to any system external to the personalization network and not in the dedicated DMZ are restricted to only pre-approved functions that have been authorized by the VPA; and

  • “Write” functions do not allow the transmission of cardholder data involving direct writes from the system(s) containing the information.

controls.control: Control at all times the physical connection points leading into the personalization network and cloud-based provisioning network.

testingProcedures.description: Observe physical connection points leading into the personalization network and cloud-based provisioning network to verify they are controlled at all times.

controls.control: Prevent data from being tampered with or monitored by protecting the network cabling associated with personalization-data movement.

testingProcedures.description: Observe a sample of personalization network cabling to verify that access is restricted, the cabling is protected, and safeguards are in place to avoid tampering.

controls.control: Transfer required issuer data and keys into the personalization network or the cloud-based provisioning network via a defined and documented process.

testingProcedures.description: Examine procedures to verify they define the process by which issuer data and keys are transferred to the personalization and cloud-based provisioning networks.
Interview personnel to verify that the data transfer process conforms to documented procedures.

controls.control: Ensure a process is in place for updates and patches and identification of their criticality, as detailed in Section 5.3, “Configuration and Patch Management.”

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to verify they include a process for updates and patches that includes identification of their criticality as delineated in the Section 5.3, “Configuration and Patch Management.”

controls.control: Have the capability to detect, isolate, and correct abnormal operations on cloud-based provisioning network systems and on cloud-based provisioning network endpoints on a real-time basis, 24/7.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify that system-monitoring assets are functional and utilized.

Examine evidence to verify that abnormal operations on cloud-based provisioning network systems and on cloud-based provisioning network endpoints can be:

  • Detected,

  • Isolated, and

  • Corrected

on a real-time and 24/7 basis.

controls.control: Network Devices
controls.description:
The requirements in this section apply to all hardware⎯e.g., routers, controllers, firewalls, storage devices—that comprises the data-preparation and personalization networks.

The vendor must:

controls.control: Document the process to authorize all changes to network devices and protocols.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of change-management logs for network devices and protocols to verify the changes are authorized.
Examine documented procedures to verify a process is in place to authorize all changes to network devices and protocols prior to implementation.

controls.control: Document the current network device configuration settings, rulesets, and justification for each device.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify they are familiar with the documentation and process by which the documentation is updated.
Examine a sample of network device documentation to verify configuration settings, rulesets, and their justifications are documented.

controls.control: Ensure all available services are approved by an authorized security manager.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to identify available services.
Examine evidence that available services were approved by an authorized security manager.

controls.control: Implement logical and physical security controls that protect the integrity of network devices used.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documentation of logical and physical security controls that protect the integrity of network devices used to verify existence.
Observe a sample of the controls to verify effective implementation.

controls.control: Implement mechanisms to effectively monitor the activity on network devices.

testingProcedures.description: Examine policies and procedures to verify mechanisms are defined to effectively monitor the activity on network devices.
Interview personnel to verify mechanisms are defined and implemented to effectively monitor the activity on network devices.

controls.control: Implement patches in compliance with Section 5.3, “Configuration and Patch Management.”

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of device configurations and verify that patches have been implemented in compliance with Section 5.3.

controls.control: Maintain an audit trail of all changes and the associated approval.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of change-control logs to verify that an audit trail of changes and associated approvals is maintained.

controls.control: Implement unique IDs for each administrator.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of administrator IDs and verify that unique IDs are used.

controls.control: Implement network device backups—e.g., system software, configuration data, and database files—prior to any change, and securely store and manage all media.

testingProcedures.description: Examine procedures for backups and managing backup media to verify media are securely stored and managed.
Observe the media storage location to verify it provides a secure storage environment.
Examine change-control documentation to verify there is a process for backing up network devices prior to any changes to those devices.

controls.control: Implement a mechanism to ensure that only authorized changes are made to network devices.

testingProcedures.description: Examine network device change logs to verify that changes to network devices were authorized before implementation.

controls.control: Firewalls
controls.description: The requirements in this section apply to firewalls protecting the data-preparation and personalization networks.

controls.control: General
Ensure all documents relating to firewall configurations are stored securely.

testingProcedures.description:
Observe the firewall configuration documentation storage area to verify:

  • Hard copy and non-digital documentation are stored in locked/secured areas accessible only to authorized personnel.

  • Digital records are stored in a secure directory with access limited to authorized personnel.

controls.control: Deploy an external firewall outside the HSA to protect the HSA’s DMZ.

testingProcedures.description: Examine network diagrams and other relevant materials to verify that an external firewall outside the HSA is implemented to protect the HSA’s DMZ in accordance with acceptable configurations.
Examine firewall rules to verify that an external firewall is in place outside the HSA to protect the HSA’s DMZ.

controls.control: Install a firewall between the data-preparation network and the personalization network unless both are located within the same high security area or network.

testingProcedures.description: Examine firewall rules to verify the separation via a firewall between the data-preparation network and the personalization network unless both are located within the same high security area or network.

controls.control: Deploy physically separate firewalls between the external network and the DMZ and between the DMZ and the cloud-based provisioning network.

testingProcedures.description: Examine network diagrams and firewall rules to verify that firewalls are installed between the external network and the DMZ and between the DMZ and the cloud-based provisioning network.

controls.control: Have the capability to detect, isolate, and correct abnormal operations on network systems on a real-time basis, 24/7, on the external (DMZ) facing firewall.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine documentation to verify that abnormal operations on network systems can be:

  • Detected,

  • Isolated, and

  • Corrected

on a real-time, 24/7, basis.

Examine a sample of logs to verify that abnormal operations on network systems are:

  • Detected,

  • Isolated, and

  • Corrected

on a real-time, 24/7, basis.

controls.control: Implement appropriate operating-system controls on firewalls.

testingProcedures.description: Examine configurations to verify that appropriate operating-system controls are implemented on firewalls.

controls.control:
Review firewall rule sets and validate supporting business justification either:

  • Monthly, or

  • Quarterly with review after every firewall configuration change.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine evidence that firewall rule sets have been validated either:

  • Monthly, or

  • After every firewall configuration change and every 3 months.
Examine a sample of firewall rule sets to verify that their business justification is documented.

controls.control: Restrict physical and logical access to firewalls to only those designated personnel who are authorized to perform firewall or router administration activities.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of access rules to verify logical access is restricted to only those designated personnel who are authorized to perform firewall or router administration activities.
Observe the firewall/router environment to verify that that physical access to firewalls is limited to only those designated personnel who are authorized to perform administration activities.

controls.control: Ensure the firewall rule set is such that any server only requiring inbound connections (for example, web servers) is prohibited from making outbound connections, and vice versa.

testingProcedures.description: Examine firewall rules to verify that firewall and router configurations prohibit making outbound connection when only inbound traffic is expected.
Examine firewall rules to verify that firewall and router configurations prohibit incoming connections when only outbound traffic is expected.

controls.control: Ensure that only authorized individuals can perform firewall administration.

testingProcedures.description: Examine policies and procedures to verify that only authorized individuals can perform firewall administration.
Interview personnel to verify firewall administration is restricted to authorized individuals.
Examine a sample of access rules to verify that only authorized individuals can perform firewall administration.

controls.control: Run firewalls and routers on dedicated hardware. All non-firewall-related software such as compilers, editors, and communication software must be deleted or disabled.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of firewalls and routers to verify they are dedicated hardware from which all non-firewall related software has been deleted or disabled.
Examine documentation to verify that non-firewall related software is deleted or disabled from firewalls and routers.

controls.control: Implement daily, automated analysis reports to monitor firewall activity.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence that automated tools exist to monitor and analyze firewall activity.
Observe a sample of firewall analysis reports to verify that automated analysis is in place and that daily reports are produced.

controls.control: Use unique administrator passwords for firewalls used by the personalization system as well as those passwords used for other network devices in the facility.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify that unique passwords are established for firewall administration.
Examine authentication policies and procedures to verify passwords for firewall administration are different than passwords used for other network devices.

controls.control: Implement both mechanisms to protect firewall and router system logs from tampering, and procedures to check the integrity of the logs monthly.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence that firewall and router system logs are protected from modification and a mechanism is in place to check their integrity monthly.

controls.control: Explicitly permit inbound and outbound traffic to the cloud-based provisioning and personalization networks. A rule must be in place to deny all other traffic.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine a sample of firewall and router configurations to verify that:

  • Approved inbound and outbound traffic for cloud-based provisioning and personalization networks is explicitly permitted; and

  • All other inbound and outbound traffic is specifically denied—for example by using an explicit “deny all” or an implicit “deny after allow” statement.
Examine firewall and router configuration standards to verify that they identify inbound and outbound traffic necessary for the cloud-based provisioning and personalization network.

controls.control: Configuration
Be configured to permit network access to required services only.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of system configuration settings to verify that the configurations permit network access to only required services.
Examine policies and procedures for permitting network access to only required services.

controls.control: Be hardened in accordance with industry best practices, if the firewall is implemented on a commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) operating system.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of firewall configuration files to verify the configurations are consistent with industry-accepted hardening standards.
Examine policies and procedures for hardening firewalls in accordance with industry best practices.

controls.control: Prohibit direct public access between any external networks and any system component that stores cardholder data.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of firewall and router configurations to verify there is no direct access between the Internet and system components that store cardholder data.
Examine policies and procedures for prohibiting direct public access between any external networks and any system component that stores cardholder data to verify existence.

controls.control: Prevent the disclosure of private IP addresses and routing information from internal networks to the Internet by implementing IP masquerading or Network Address Translation (NAT) on the firewall between the DMZ and personalization and the cloud-based provisioning networks.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of firewall and router configurations to verify that methods are in place on the firewall between the DMZ and personalization and the cloud-based provisioning networks to prevent the disclosure of private IP addresses and routing information from internal networks to the Internet.

Examine policies and procedures for implementing IP masquerading or Network Address Translation (NAT) on the firewall between the DMZ and personalization and the cloud-based provisioning networks to verify existence.

controls.control: If managed remotely, be managed according to Section 4.6, “Remote Access.”

testingProcedures.description: If firewalls are managed remotely, examine policy and procedures documentation to verify management activities are managed according to Section 4.6.

controls.control: Be configured to deny all services not expressly permitted.

testingProcedures.description: Observe a sample of configuration settings to verify that all services not expressly permitted default to “deny.”

controls.control: Disable all unnecessary services, protocols, and ports. Authorized services must be documented with a business justification and be approved by the IT Security Manager.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of services, protocols, and ports to verify that their business justification is documented, and that they were approved by the IT Security Manager.
Examine a sample of systems/networks to verify that unnecessary services are disabled.
Interview personnel to identify necessary services, protocols, and ports.

controls.control: Disable source routing on the firewall.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of firewall configurations to verify that source routing is disabled.

controls.control: Notify the administrator in real time of any items requiring immediate attention.

testingProcedures.description: Interview administrators to verify that administrator(s) are notified in real time and that immediate attention is given when required.
Examine policy and procedures to verify that administrator(s) are to be notified in real time of any items requiring immediate attention.

controls.control:
Maintain documented baseline security configuration standards for system components based on industry-accepted system hardening standards, which include, but are not limited to:

  • Center for Internet Security (CIS)

  • International Organization for Standardization (ISO)

  • SysAdmin Audit Network Security (SANS) Institute

  • National Institute of Standards Technology (NIST)

At a minimum, baseline configuration must address:

  • User and group access security

  • File and directory security

  • Restricted services

  • System update and installation standards

  • Installed security software

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify the baseline configuration standard is based on an industry standard.

Examine policies and procedures to verify that a baseline configuration has been established for the organization’s system components and addresses at a minimum, but not limited to:

  • User and group access security

  • File and directory security

  • Restricted services

  • System update and installation standards

  • Installed security software

controls.control:
The vendor must perform baseline security configurations checks in the cloud- based provisioning environment either:

  • Monthly, or

  • Quarterly with review after each configuration change.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine evidence to verify that the baseline security configuration was validated either:

  • Monthly, or

  • Quarterly with review after each configuration change.

Examine a sample of baseline configuration checks to verify that they occurred either:

  • Monthly, or

  • Quarterly with review after each configuration change.

controls.control: Anti-virus Software or Programs

Define, document, and follow procedures to demonstrate:

  • Identification of security alerts—e.g., subscribing to security alerts such as Microsoft and the Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT)

  • Identification of system component updates that affect the supportability and stability of operating systems, software drivers, and firmware components

  • Inventory of current systems in the environment including information about installed software components and about running services

testingProcedures.description:
Examine policies and procedures documentation to verify coverage of:

  • Identification of security alerts—e.g., subscribing to security alerts such as Microsoft and the Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT)

  • Identification of system component updates that affect the supportability and stability of operating systems, software drivers, and firmware components

  • Inventory of current systems in the environment including information about installed software components and about running services
Interview personnel to ensure procedures are known and followed.

controls.control: Deploy anti-virus software on all systems potentially affected by malicious software—e.g., personal computers and servers.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of system components potentially affected by malicious software to verify that anti-virus software is deployed.

controls.control: Ensure that all anti-virus mechanisms are current, actively running, and generating audit logs.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine a sample of system components to verify that:

  • Anti-virus software is present and running.

  • Activity logs are generated.

controls.control: Check for anti-virus updates at least daily and install updates in a manner consistent with Patch Management. Documentation must exist for why any updates were not installed.

testingProcedures.description: Examine policies and procedures to verify that anti-virus software and definitions are required to be kept up to date.
Examine a sample of systems to verify that either updates (based upon alerts collected as part of 4.5.a) were applied or documentation exists for why they were not.

controls.control: Remote Access
controls.description: For purposes of this section, this applies to remote administration by the vendor, and not issuer connections.

controls.control: Connection Conditions
Remote access is permitted only for the administration of the network or system components.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of users with remote access to verify such access is permitted only for the administration of the network or system components.
Examine policies and procedures to verify that remote access is permitted only for the administration of the network or system components.

controls.control: Access from outside the facility to the physical access-control system is not permitted except as used in conjunction with an approved SOC.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of system configurations to verify that remote access is not permitted from outside the facility to the physical access-control system except as used in connection an approved SOC.

controls.control: Remote access—i.e., from outside the HSA—for administrative activities is permitted only from pre-determined and authorized locations using vendor-approved systems.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of remote access system configurations and access logs to verify access is accepted only from pre-determined and authorized locations using vendor-approved systems.

controls.control: Access using personally owned hardware is prohibited.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of remote access system configurations and access logs to verify that remote access from personally owned devices is not permitted.
Examine policies and procedures to verify that remote access using a personally owned device is prohibited.

controls.control: Remote access is not permitted where qualified personnel are temporarily off-site and remote access is a convenience.

testingProcedures.description: Examine policies and procedures to verify that remote access is not permitted when qualified personnel are temporarily off-site.

controls.control: The remote access process must be fully documented and include at least the following components:
System components for which remote access is permitted

testingProcedures.description:
Examine policies and procedures to verify the remote access process is fully documented and includes the following components but is not limited to:

  • System components for which remote access is permitted

controls.control: The location from which remote access is permitted

testingProcedures.description:
Examine policies and procedures to verify the remote access process is fully documented and includes the following components but is not limited to:

  • The location from which remote access is permitted

controls.control: The conditions under which remote access is acceptable

testingProcedures.description:
Examine policies and procedures to verify the remote access process is fully documented and includes the following components but is not limited to:

  • The conditions under which remote access is acceptable

controls.control: Users with remote access permission

testingProcedures.description:
Examine policies and procedures to verify the remote access process is fully documented and includes the following components but is not limited to:

  • Users with remote access permission

controls.control: The access privileges applicable to each authorized user

testingProcedures.description:
Examine policies and procedures to verify the remote access process is fully documented and includes the following components but is not limited to:

  • The access privileges applicable to each authorized user

controls.control: All access privileges must be validated on a quarterly basis by an authorized individual.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documentation from a sample of reviews to verify that remote access privileges are reviewed at least quarterly by an authorized individual.

controls.control: Remote access is prohibited to any system where clear-text cardholder data is being processed.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of system configurations to verify that remote access is not permitted to any system where clear-text cardholder data is being processed.

controls.control: Remote access is prohibited to clear-text cardholder data, clear-text cryptographic keys, or clear-text key components/shares.

testingProcedures.description: Examine remote access policies and procedures to verify that remote access is not permitted to clear-text cardholder data, clear-text cryptographic keys, or clear-text key components/shares.

controls.control: The vendor must:
Ensure that systems allowing remote connections accept connections only from preauthorized source systems.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine policies and procedures to verify the following, at a minimum:

  • Systems allowing remote connections accept connections only from preauthorized source systems.

controls.control: Ensure remote administration is predefined and preauthorized by the vendor.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine policies and procedures to verify the following, at a minimum:

  • Remote administration is predefined and preauthorized by the vendor.

controls.control: Ensure remote changes comply with change-management requirements as outlined in Section 5.2, “Change Management.”

testingProcedures.description:
Examine policies and procedures to verify the following, at a minimum:

  • Remote changes comply with change-management requirements as outlined in Section 5.2, “Change Management.”

controls.control: Ensure that all remote access locations are included in the facility’s compliance assessment and meet these requirements.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine policies and procedures to verify the following, at a minimum:

  • All remote access locations are included in the facility’s compliance assessment and meet these requirements.

controls.control: Be able to provide evidence of compliance validation for any remote access location.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine policies and procedures to verify the following, at a minimum:

  • The vendor is able to provide evidence of compliance validation for any remote access location.

controls.control: Ensure that non-vendor staff performing remote administration maintain liability insurance to cover potential losses. All personnel performing remote administration must meet the same pre-screening qualification requirements as card production staff working in high security areas.

testingProcedures.description: Interview a sample of non-vendor staff performing remote administration and verify that they maintain liability insurance to cover potential losses.
Examine policies and procedures to verify that personnel performing remote administration must meet the same pre-screening qualification requirements as employees working in high security areas.

controls.control: All remote access must use a VPN that meets the requirements in the following section.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of remote access to verify that remote access occurs using a VPN that meets the requirements of Section 4.6.2, “Virtual Private Network (VPN).”

controls.control: Virtual Private Network (VPN)

For remote access, VPNs must start from the originating device—e.g., PC or off-the-shelf device specifically designed for secure remote access—and terminate at either the target device or the personalization firewall. If the termination point is the firewall, it must use IPSec or at least a TLS connection in accordance with PCI Data Security Requirement 4.1 to the target device.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine VPN system documentation and a sample of configuration settings to verify that:

  • For remote access, VPNs must start from the originating device and terminate at either the target device or the personalization firewall.

  • When terminating at the personalization firewall, an IPSec or TLS connection to the target device is used in accordance with PCI Data Security Requirement 4.1.

controls.control: For remote access to DMZ components, the VPN must terminate at the target device.

testingProcedures.description: Examine policy and procedure documentation to verify that it defines that VPN tunnels for remote access to DMZ components must terminate at the target device.

controls.control: SSL and TLS 1.0/1.1 are expressly prohibited in connection with the aforementioned.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of system configurations to verify that for remote access to DMZ components, SSL and TLS 1.0 are disabled.

controls.control: Traffic on the VPN must be encrypted using Triple DES with at least double-length keys or Advanced Encryption Standard (AES).

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of system configurations to verify that only the listed algorithms are permitted.

controls.control: Modifications to the VPN must be in compliance with the change- management requirements as outlined in Section 5.2, “Change Management.”

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of modifications made to VPN configurations and verify that changes are in compliance with the change-management requirements as outlined in Section 5.2, “Change Management.”

controls.control: Mechanisms—e.g., digital signatures, checksums—must exist to detect unauthorized changes to VPN configuration and change- control settings.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of VPN configuration files and change-control settings to verify they are protected from unauthorized modifications using mechanisms such as digital signatures and checksums.

controls.control: Multi-factor authentication must be used for all VPN connections.

testingProcedures.description: Observe a sample of VPN access processes to verify multi-factor authentication is used.
Examine a sample of VPN system documentation and configuration settings to verify multi-factor authentication is used for VPN connections.

controls.control: Access must be declined after three consecutive unsuccessful access attempts.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of system component configuration setting to verify that authentication parameters are set to require that user accounts be locked out after not more than three consecutive invalid logon attempts.

controls.control: Access counters must only be reset by an authorized individual after user validation by another authorized individual.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documentation for access counter resets to verify that it is only reset by an authorized individual after user validation by another authorized individual.

controls.control: The connection must time out within five minutes if the session is inactive.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of system component configuration settings to verify that system/session idle time-out features have been set to five minutes or less.

controls.control: Remote access must be logged, and the log must be reviewed weekly for suspicious activity. Evidence of log review must be maintained.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to verify remote access logs are reviewed at least weekly to identify suspicious activity and that evidence of log review is retained.
Examine a sample of system configurations and audit logs to verify that remote access is logged and logs are reviewed.

controls.control: VPN traffic using Internet Protocol Security (IPsec) must meet the following additional requirements:
Tunnel mode must be used except where communication is host-to-host.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine a sample of VPN configuration files to verify that the following requirements, at a minimum, are met:

  • Tunnel mode is used except where communication is host-to-host.

controls.control: Aggressive mode must not be used for tunnel establishment.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine a sample of VPN configuration files to verify that the following requirements, at a minimum, are met:

  • Aggressive mode is not to be used for tunnel establishment.

controls.control: The device authentication method must use certificates obtained from a trusted Certificate Authority.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine a sample of VPN configuration files to verify that the following requirements, at a minimum, are met:

  • The device authentication method uses certificates obtained from a trusted Certificate Authority.

controls.control: Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) must be used to provide data confidentiality and authentication.
