  • Expiration date (if applicable)

  • Key purpose/type

  • Key length
Examine documentation of key-inventory control and monitoring procedures to verify all keys are identified and accounted for in the inventory.
Interview personnel to verify that key-inventory procedures are known and followed.

controls.control: All derivation keys must be unique per issuer.

testingProcedures.description: Interview key custodians and key-management supervisory personnel to verify the implementation of the aforementioned.
Examine key-management documentation to verify that all derivation keys are unique per issuer.

controls.control: IC keys must be unique per IC.

testingProcedures.description: Examine key-management documentation to verify that all IC keys are unique per IC.
Interview key custodians and key-management supervisory personnel to verify the implementation of the aforementioned.

controls.control: Transport keys used for mobile provisioning must be unique per device.

testingProcedures.description: Examine key-management documentation to verify that transport keys used for mobile provisioning are unique per device.
Interview key custodians and key-management supervisory personnel to verify the implementation of the aforementioned.

controls.control: Key Back-up/Recovery
controls.description: It is not a requirement to have backup copies of key components, shares, or keys. However, if backup copies are used, the requirements below must be met.

controls.control: Ensure that key back-up and recovery are part of the business recovery/resumption plans of the organization.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to verify that key back-up and recovery are part of the business recovery/resumption plans of the organization.

controls.control: Require a minimum of two authorized individuals to enable the recovery of keys.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented recovery procedures to verify that recovery of keys requires dual control.
Interview key custodians and key-management supervisory personnel to verify the implementation of the aforementioned.

controls.control: All relevant policies and procedures that apply to production keys must also apply to backup keys.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures and backup records to determine whether any backup copies of keys or their components exist.
Examine documented procedures and backup records to determine whether any backup copies of keys or their components exist.

controls.control: Vendor must prohibit the loading of backup keys into a failed device until the reason for that failure has been ascertained and the problem has been corrected.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented to verify the procedures ensure that the loading of backup keys into failed devices is not permitted until after the reason for that failure has been ascertained and the problem has been corrected.
Interview key custodians and key-management supervisory personnel to verify the implementation of the aforementioned.

controls.control: The back-up of keys must conform to Information Security Policy.

testingProcedures.description: Interview key custodians and key-management supervisory personnel to verify the implementation of the aforementioned.
Examine documented procedures to verify that the back-up of keys conforms to the organization’s Information Security Policy.

controls.control: All access to backup storage locations must be witnessed and logged under dual control.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to verify that all access to all backup storage locations is witnessed and logged under dual control.
Interview key custodians and key-management supervisory personnel to verify the implementation of the aforementioned.

controls.control: Key Destruction
controls.description: The following requirements relating to the destruction of clear keys, components, and shares must be met.

controls.control: Immediately destroy key components/shares that are no longer required after successful loading and validation as operational.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of key-history logs and key-destruction logs to verify that all key components/shares have been destroyed immediately upon completion of loading.
Examine documented procedures to verify processes are in place for destroying keys and their components/shares after successful loading and validation.
Examine storage locations for key components/shares that have been loaded to verify they are no longer present.

controls.control: When a cryptographic device—e.g., HSM—is decommissioned, any data stored and any resident cryptographic keys must be deleted or otherwise destroyed.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify that all keying material is rendered irrecoverable (for example, zeroized), or that devices are physically destroyed under dual control to prevent the disclosure of any sensitive data or keys.

Observe processes for removing cryptographic devices from service to verify that tests and inspections of devices are performed to confirm that keys have been rendered irrecoverable or the devices are physically destroyed.

controls.control: Securely destroy all copies of keys that are no longer required for card production or provisioning.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to verify processes are in place for destroying all copies (including backups) of keys that are no longer required.

controls.control: All key destruction must be logged, and the log retained for verification.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of key-destruction logs to verify that all copies of keys have been destroyed once the keys are no longer required.

controls.control: Destroy keys and key components/shares so that it is impossible to recover them by physical or electronic means.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures for destroying keys and key components/shares and confirm they are sufficient to ensure that no part of the key or component can be recovered.
Observe key-destruction processes to verify that no part of the key or component can be recovered.

controls.control: If a key that resides inside a HSM cannot be destroyed, the device itself must be destroyed in a manner that ensures it is irrecoverable.

testingProcedures.description: Interview key custodians and key-management supervisory personnel to verify the implementation of the aforementioned.
Examine documented procedures for removing HSMs from service to verify that if any key within the HSM cannot be destroyed, the device itself is destroyed in a manner that ensures it is irrecoverable.

controls.control: Destroy all hard-copy key components/shares maintained on paper by cross-shredding, pulping, or burning. Strip shredding is not sufficient.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to verify all hard-copy key components/shares maintained on paper are destroyed by cross-shredding, pulping, or burning—and not by strip shredding.
Interview key custodians and key-management supervisory personnel to verify the implementation of the aforementioned.

controls.control: Electronically stored keys must either be overwritten with random data a minimum of three times or destroyed by smashing so they cannot be reassembled.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine documented procedures to verify that keys stored on electronic media are:

  • Overwritten with random data a minimum of three times, and/or

  • Destroyed by smashing so they cannot be reassembled.
Interview personnel to verify the implementation of the aforementioned.

controls.control: Destroy all key components under dual presence with appropriate key-destruction affidavits signed by the applicable key custodian.

testingProcedures.description: Observe a demonstration of processes for removing keys from service to verify that dual control is implemented.

Examine documented procedures for destroying keys to verify that dual control is implemented and key-destruction affidavits are signed by the applicable key custodian for all key-component destruction processes.
Examine a sample of key-destruction logs and verify that the key custodian signs an affidavit as a witness to the key destruction process.

controls.control: A person who is not a key custodian for any part of that key must witness the destruction and also sign the key-destruction affidavits, which are kept indefinitely. (This person may also fulfill the dual-presence requirement above or be a third person to the activity.)

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of key-destruction logs and verify that a witness who is not a key custodian for any component of the key signs an affidavit as a witness to the key-destruction process.
Observe the key-destruction process and verify that it is witnessed by a person who is not a key custodian for any component of that key; or

controls.control: Key-Management Audit Trail

Key-management logs must contain, at a minimum, for each recorded activity:

  • The date and time of the activity took place

  • The action taken—e.g., whether key generation, key distribution, key destruction

  • Name and signature of the person performing the action (may be more than one name and signature if split responsibility is involved)

  • Countersignature of the Key Manager or CISO

  • Pre-serialized key envelope number, if applicable

testingProcedures.description:
Examine key-management logs to verify the following is recorded for each activity:

  • The date and time of the activity took place

  • The action taken—e.g., key generation, key distribution, key destruction

  • Name and signature of the person performing the action (may be more than one name and signature if split responsibility is involved)

  • Countersignature of the Key Manager or CISO (or equivalent)

  • Pre-serialized key envelope number, if applicable

controls.control: Key-management logs must be retained for at least the life span of the key(s) to which they relate.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of key-management logs for different types of keys and verify logs are retained for the life span of the key(s) to which they relate.
Examine documented procedures to verify procedures require key-management logs must be retained for the life span of the key(s) to which they relate.

controls.control: The vendor must prohibit access to key-management logs by any personnel outside of the Key Manager or authorized individuals.

testingProcedures.description: Observe access to a sample of key-management logs to verify it is only permitted to authorized individuals.
Examine documented procedures to ensure access to key-management logs is only permitted for the Key Manager or authorized individuals.

controls.control: Any facility to reset the sequence number generator or other mechanisms such as time and date stamps in the HSM must be restricted.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to ensure procedures restrict access to any capability to reset the sequence number generator or other mechanisms in the HSM.
Examine access-control lists or other processes to verify that only authorized personnel have access to the sequence number generator.

controls.control: The CISO or an authorized individual must investigate all audit log validation failures.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to verify the CISO (or equivalent) investigates all audit log validation failures.
Interview personnel to verify the implementation of the aforementioned.

controls.control: During the personalization process, an electronic log must be maintained to identify what keys were used.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documentation to verify an electronic log is maintained to identify keys used during the personalization process.
Examine documentation to verify an electronic log is maintained to identify keys used during the personalization process.

controls.control: The vendor must ensure that the deletion of any audit trail is prevented.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to verify controls are defined for protecting audit trails from unauthorized deletion.
Examine a sample of system configurations to verify controls are implemented to prevent unauthorized deletion of audit trails.

controls.control: Key Compromise
controls.description: The following requirements relate to the procedures for dealing with any known or suspected key compromise. Unless otherwise stated, the following applies to vendor-owned keys.

controls.control: The vendor must define procedures that include the following:
Who is to be notified in the event of a key compromise? At a minimum, this must include the CISO, Key Manager, IT Security Manager, and the VPA.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify that procedures are known and followed.
Examine documented procedures for key compromise to verify they include who is to be notified; and at a minimum include the CISO (or equivalent), Key Manager, IT Security Manager, and the VPA.

controls.control: The actions to be taken to protect and/or recover system software and/or hardware, symmetric and asymmetric keys, previously generated signatures, and encrypted data.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify that procedures are known and followed.

Examine documented procedures for key compromise to verify they include the actions to be taken to protect and/or recover system software and/or hardware, symmetric and asymmetric keys, previously generated signatures, and encrypted data.

controls.control: An investigation into the cause of the compromise, including a documented analysis of how and why the event occurred and the damages suffered.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify that procedures are known and followed.

Examine documented procedures for key compromise to verify they include requiring an investigation into the cause of the compromise, including a documented analysis of how and why the event occurred and the damages suffered.

controls.control: That the vendor will remove from operational use all compromised keys within a predefined time frame and provide a means of migrating to new key(s).

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures for key compromise to verify they include that the vendor will remove from operational use all compromised keys within a predefined time frame and provide a means of migrating to new key(s).
Interview personnel to verify that procedures are known and followed.

controls.control: Where keys are issuer-owned, the issuer must be notified immediately for further instruction.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures for key compromise to verify they include that where keys are issuer-owned, the issuer must be notified immediately for further instruction.
Interview personnel to verify that procedures are known and followed.

controls.control: Ensure that the replacement key is not a variant of the compromised key.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to ensure replacement keys are not created from a variant of the compromise key.
Interview personnel to verify the implementation of the aforementioned.

controls.control: Where a key compromise is suspected but not yet proven, the Key Manager must have the ability to activate emergency key-replacement procedures.

testingProcedures.description: Interview Key Manager to verify he/she is aware of their responsibility and understand the procedures to activate emergency key-replacement procedures.
Examine documented procedures to verify that in the event of a suspected key compromise, the Key Manager has authority to activate emergency key replacement procedures.

controls.control: In the event of known or suspected key compromise, all instances of the key must be immediately revoked pending the outcome of the investigation. Known compromised keys must be replaced.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify that procedures are understood and communicated to affected personnel.
Examine documented procedures to verify they require that in the event of a suspected key compromise, all instances of the key must be immediately revoked pending the outcome of the investigation.

controls.control: All keys that are encrypted with a key that has been revoked must also be revoked.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify that procedures are understood and communicated to affected personnel.
Examine documented procedures to verify that all keys encrypted with a key that has been revoked are also revoked.

controls.control: In the event that a KEK has been compromised, all keys encrypted with the KEK must be replaced.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to verify that if a KEK is compromised, the KEK and all keys encrypted with that KEK are replaced.
Interview personnel to verify that procedures are understood and communicated to affected personnel.

controls.control: In the event that a MDK has been compromised, all keys derived from that master key must be replaced.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to verify that if a MDK is compromised, the MDK and all keys derived from that MDK are replaced.
Interview personnel to verify that procedures are understood and communicated to affected personnel.

controls.control: The payment system VPA must be notified within 24 hours of a known or suspected compromise.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to verify steps include notification of the VPA within 24 hours of a known or suspected compromise.

controls.control: Data items that have been signed using a key that has been revoked—e.g., a public-key certificate—must be withdrawn as soon as practically possible and replaced once a new key is in place.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to verify data items that have been signed with a key that has been revoked are withdrawn as soon as possible and replaced.
Interview personnel to verify that procedures are understood and communicated to affected personnel.

controls.control: Key-Management Security Hardware
All key-management activity must be performed using an HSM.

testingProcedures.description: Examine policies/procedures to verify all key-management activity uses an HSM.

controls.control: When in its normal operational state:
All of the HSM’s tamper-resistant mechanisms must be activated.

testingProcedures.description: Observe HSMs in normal operational state to verify they are configured according to the documented procedures, and that all of the HSM’s tamper-resistant mechanisms are activated.
Examine documented procedures to verify that when the HSM is in its normal operational state, all of the HSM’s tamper-resistant mechanisms must be activated.

controls.control: All physical keys must be removed.

testingProcedures.description: Observe HSMs in normal operational state to verify they are configured according to the documented procedures, and that all physical keys are removed.
Examine documented procedures to verify that when the HSM is in its normal operational state, all physical keys must be removed.

controls.control: All unnecessary externally attached devices must be removed (such as an operator terminal).

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to verify that when the HSM is in its normal operational state, all unnecessary externally attached devices must be removed (such as an operator terminal).

Observe HSMs in normal operational state to verify they are configured according to the documented procedures, and that all unnecessary externally attached devices are removed (such as an operator terminal).

controls.control: HSMs used for key management or otherwise used for the protection of sensitive data must be approved by PCI or certified to FIPS 140-2 or 140-3 Level 3 or higher certification for physical security.

testingProcedures.description:
Examine documentation to ensure that all HSMs used for key management or otherwise used for the protection of sensitive data are:

  • Approved by PCI or certified to FIPS 140-2or 140-3 level 3 or higher.

  • Listed on the PCI SSC website with a valid PCI SSC listing number, as an Approved PCI PTS Device under the approval class “HSM.”

  • Listed on the NIST Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP) list with a valid listing number and approved to FIPS 140-2 or 140-3 Level 3 (overall), or higher. Refer to http://csrc.nist.gov.

controls.control: HSMs must be brought into service only if there is assurance that the equipment has not been subject to unauthorized modification, substitution, or tampering. This requires physical protection of the device up to the point of key insertion or inspection.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify that HSMs are physically protected up to the point of key insertion or inspection, to provide assurance that the HSM has not been substituted or subjected to unauthorized modifications or tampering.
Examine documented procedures to verify that HSMs are not brought into service unless there is assurance that the HSM has not been substituted or subjected to unauthorized modifications or tampering.

controls.control: The process for the installation and commissioning of the HSM must be documented and logged.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures and logs for HSM installations to verify processes for installation and commissioning of HSMs are documented and logged.

controls.control: When an HSM is removed from service permanently or for repair, all operational keys must be deleted from the device prior to its removal.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures for removing HSMs from service to verify that all operational keys are deleted from the device (for example, zeroized) prior to its removal from service.
Observe demonstration of processes for removing HSMs from service to verify all operational keys are deleted from the device.

controls.control: The removal process for the repair or decommissioning of the HSM must be documented and logged.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures and interview personnel to verify that processes for removal of an HSM for repair or decommissioning must be documented and logged.
Observe processes and examine logs for HSM removal to verify processes for removal of an HSM for repair or decommissioning are documented and logged.

controls.control: The HSM must be under physical dual control at all times.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented procedures to verify that HSMs must be under physical dual control at all times when accessed or when in any privileged mode.
Examine HSM storage locations and records to ensure they have been managed under dual control after receipt.
Interview personnel to verify that procedures are understood and communicated to affected personnel.

controls.control: Key Management: Confidential Data
General Principles
Key-encipherment keys must meet the minimum key sizes as delineated in Normative Annex A.

testingProcedures.description: Examine the documented key hierarchy and verify keys meet the minimum key sizes as delineated in Normative Annex A.

controls.control: All key-encrypting keys used to transmit or convey other cryptographic keys must be at least as strong as the key being transmitted or conveyed.

testingProcedures.description: Examine the documented key hierarchy to verify keys used to transmit or convey other cryptographic keys are at least as strong as the key being transmitted.

Examine documented key-management policies and procedures to verify a policy exists that requires key-encrypting keys (KEKs) used to transmit or convey other cryptographic keys be at least as strong as the key being transmitted or conveyed.

Observe key-management operations and device configurations to verify that all key-encrypting keys (KEKs) used to transmit or convey other cryptographic keys are at least as strong as the key being transmitted or conveyed.

controls.control: Cryptographic keys must not be hard-coded into software.

testingProcedures.description: Examine software configuration files (for example, shell scripts, command files, communication scripts, software code etc.) to verify that cryptographic keys are not embedded.
Examine documented key-management policies and procedures to verify a policy exists that prohibits hard-coded cryptographic in software.
Interview personnel to verify that the embedding of cryptographic keys into software (for example, in shell scripts, command files, communication scripts, software code etc.) is strictly prohibited.

controls.control: Audit trails must be maintained for all key-management activities.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of key-management audit logs to verify their existence and that they address all key-management activities—e.g., generation, conveyance, destruction, etc.
Interview personnel to verify audit trails are maintained for all key-management activities.

controls.control: Key-management activities must be performed by vendor or issuer staff.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify key-management activities are only performed by authorized personnel.
Examine a sample of key-management audit logs to verify key-management activities are only performed by vendor or issuer staff.

controls.control: Key-management activities must only be performed by fully trained and authorized personnel.

testingProcedures.description: Examine the vendor’s training requirements for individuals involved with key-management activities to verify training program and materials exist.
Examine evidence that training has been provided for identified personnel.

controls.control:
The vendor must generate keys and key components using a random or pseudo-random process using one of the following:

  • An approved key-generation function of a PCI–approved HSM

  • An approved key-generation function of a FIPS 140-2 or 140-3 Level 3 (or higher) for physical security HSM

  • An approved random number generator that has been certified by an independent qualified laboratory according to NIST SP 800-22

testingProcedures.description: An approved random number generator that has been certified by an independent qualified laboratory according to NIST SP 800-22

Examine certification letters or technical documentation to verify that all devices used to generate cryptographic keys or key components meet one of the following:

  • An approved key-generation function of a PCI-approved HSM or POI

  • An approved key-generation function of a FIPS 140-2 or FIPS 140-3 Level 3 (or higher) HSM

  • An SCD that has an approved random number generator that has been certified by an independent qualified laboratory according to NIST SP 800-22

Examine key-management procedures to verify that it requires that all devices used to generate cryptographic keys meet one of the following:

  • An approved key-generation function of a PCI–approved HSM

  • An approved key-generation function of a FIPS 140-2 or 140-3 Level 3 (or higher) for physical security HSM

controls.control: Before the vendor accepts a key, it must ensure that it knows its origin.

testingProcedures.description: Observe a demonstration of the key-acceptance process to verify the vendor knows the key’s origin.
Interview personnel to verify that as part of key-acceptance procedures, the vendor knows the key’s origin.

controls.control: Keys must be stored in a manner that preserves their integrity.

testingProcedures.description: Observe the storage locations for a sample of keys and verify the storage is adequate to preserve their integrity.

controls.control: Keys must be used for only one purpose and not shared between cryptographic zones.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of key check values to verify they are unique except by chance.
Examine documented key-management policies and procedures to verify keys must be used for only one purpose and are not shared between cryptographic zones.

controls.control: All secret and private keys must have a predefined expiry date by which they must be retired from use. No key must be used for a period longer than the designated life span of that key. Issuer keys must not be used for longer than the issuer-specified expiry date.

testingProcedures.description: Examine key-management policies and procedures to verify secret and private keys require a pre-defined expiry date.
Examine a sample of keys to identify key expiry dates and verify that active secret and private keys and issuer keys have not expired.

controls.control: There must be no process by which, once deployed, the life of a key can be extended beyond its original designated life span.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify that keys are not extended beyond their original designated life span.
Examine key-management policies and procedures to verify that they prohibit the life of a key from being extended beyond its original designated life span.

controls.control: The vendor must prohibit any keys from being shared or substituted between production and test systems.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of test and production configuration files to verify the same key check values are not present except by chance in both environments.
Interview personnel to identify controls that prohibit keys from being shared between test and production systems.

controls.control: The vendor must make certain that the life of keys used to encrypt other keys is shorter than the time required to conduct an exhaustive search of the key space.

testingProcedures.description: Examine the documented key hierarchy and verify keys meet the minimum key sizes as delineated in Normative Annex A.

controls.control: The vendor must ensure that keys exist in the minimum number of locations consistent with effective system operation.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of keys to identify storage locations and verify storage is limited to effective system operation.
Interview personnel to verify it is known that keys may only exist in the minimum number of locations consistent with effective system operation and the vendor is able to identify the locations.

controls.control: The vendor must ensure that keys are accessible only to the minimum number of people required for effective operation of the system.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify keys are only accessible to the minimum number of people required for effective system operations.

controls.control: The vendor must have a documented process for handling known or suspected key compromise that includes the revocation of the key.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify the policies and procedures are known.
Examine documented key-management policies and procedures to verify a process is defined for handling known or suspected key compromise that includes the revocation of the key.

controls.control: In the event of the compromise of a key, all instances of the key must be revoked.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented key-management policies and procedures to verify that in the event of key compromise, steps are defined to ensure all instances of the key are revoked.

controls.control: All keys that are encrypted with a key that has been revoked must also be revoked.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented key-management policies and procedures to verify that in the event of key compromise, steps are defined to ensure all keys that are encrypted with a key that has been revoked are also revoked.

controls.control: In the event that a KEK has been compromised, all keys encrypted with that KEK must be replaced.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documented key-management policies and procedures to verify that in the event of key compromise, steps are defined to ensure all keys that are encrypted with a KEK are replaced.

controls.control: PIN Distribution via Electronic Methods
General Requirements
controls.description: The following requirements apply for the distribution of PINs via electronic methods.

controls.control: The PIN distribution system must not communicate with any other system where associated cardholder data is stored or processed.

testingProcedures.description: Examine system documentation and network diagrams to identify process flows and communication channels for the PIN distribution system (PDS) to verify the PDS cannot communicate with any other system where associated cardholder data is stored or processed.
Examine interface rules or applicable controls to verify that other systems where cardholder data is stored or processed cannot communicate with the PIN distribution system.

controls.control: The PIN distribution system must run on a dedicated computer and be isolated from any other network by a dedicated firewall.

testingProcedures.description: Examine firewall configurations to verify the PIN distribution system runs on a dedicated computer and is isolated from other networks by a dedicated firewall.
Examine system documentation and network diagrams to verify that the PDS runs on a dedicated computer and is isolated from any other network by a dedicated firewall.

controls.control: The PIN distribution system must perform no other function than PIN distribution, and any sessions established during the distribution—e.g., a telephone call, an e-mail, or a SMS message—must be terminated once the PIN has been sent.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to identify controls that prohibit functions (other than PIN distribution) from being established during a PIN distribution process.
Examine a sample of logs to verify that when a session is established during a distribution—e.g., a telephone call, e-mail, or SMS message—the session is terminated once the PIN has been sent.

controls.control: During transmission to and storage in the PIN distribution system, all PIN and authentication values must be encrypted using key algorithms and sizes as stated in Normative Annex A.

testingProcedures.description: Examine system documentation and configuration to verify that during transmission to and storage in the PDS, all PIN and authentication values are encrypted using cryptographic algorithms and key sizes in accordance with Annex A.

controls.control: Communication of the PIN to the cardholder must only take place after verification of the identification value and associated authentication value.

testingProcedures.description: Interview personnel to verify communication of the PIN occurs only after verification of the identification and authentication values.
Observe demonstration of a cardholder PIN reset and verify that appropriate verification occurs prior to communicating the PIN.

controls.control: The identification and authentication values must not disclose the account number.

testingProcedures.description: Examine the identification and authentication values for a sample of PIN distribution requests to verify that account number is not present.

controls.control: The authentication value must be different than the identification value and must not be a value easily associated with the cardholder.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of PIN distribution requests to verify the authentication value is different than the identification value and is not a value easily associated with the cardholder.

controls.control: The authentication value must be communicated to the cardholder in such a way that access by anyone other than the cardholder is detected.

testingProcedures.description: Examine evidence for communicating the authentication values to the cardholder to verify they prevent undetected access by anyone other than the cardholder.

controls.control: The authentication value must be restricted to the PIN distribution system and not accessible by any other system.

testingProcedures.description: Examine identified controls to verify they restrict the authentication value to the PDS and it is not accessible by any other system.
Interview personnel to identify controls that restrict the authentication value to the PIN distribution system.

controls.control: The PIN must only be distributed in response to the receipt of valid identification and authentication values.

testingProcedures.description: Observe a demonstration of the process to ensure identification and authentication values are validated before the PIN is distributed.
Interview personnel to verify the PIN is only distributed after validation of identification and authentication values.

controls.control: The PIN distribution system must be able to identify the cardholder from the identification value in the request, and the request must contain the cardholder’s authentication value.

testingProcedures.description: Observe a demonstration of a cardholder request to verify identification and authentication values are present.

Examine the documented PIN distribution system process flow to verify the request provides the information necessary to identify the cardholder based upon the identification value and includes the cardholder authentication value.

controls.control: The distribution system must not have any way of associating an identification value or authentication value with a specific cardholder’s name, address, or account number.
The PIN distribution system must limit the number of attempts to obtain a PIN and upon exceeding this limit must alert the vendor to take further action as defined by the issuer.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of invalid attempts—e.g., a system log—where the threshold was exceeded to verify procedures were performed to take action as defined by the issuer.
Examine evidence to verify that a threshold for invalid attempts exists and upon exceeding this limit the PDS alerts the vendor to take further action as defined by the issuer.

controls.control: The PIN must only be decrypted immediately before it is passed to the final distribution channel—e.g., the telephone or e-mail system.

testingProcedures.description: Examine system documentation and PIN distribution flows to verify the PIN is only decrypted immediately before being passed to the final distribution channel.

controls.control: The PIN distribution system must not contain any other cardholder data—e.g., PAN, cardholder name).

testingProcedures.description: Interview system/database administrator to identify the PDS system locations in which cardholder data may exist.
Examine a sample of the PIN distribution system data tables or other evidentiary material to verify other cardholder data does not exist.

controls.control: The association of the PIN to a specific account must not be possible in the distribution system.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documentation to identify the controls established to prevent the association of a PIN to a specific account in the PIN distribution system.
Examine a sample of the PIN distribution system tables to verify cardholder data does not exist.

controls.control: The identification value, PIN, and authentication value must not be logged and must be deleted immediately after successful delivery is confirmed.

testingProcedures.description: Examine a sample of logs to verify the identification value, PIN, and authentication value are not captured and the data elements are deleted immediately after successful delivery is confirmed.

controls.control: If the PIN is not delivered to the cardholder, it must be deleted from the system after a fixed period of time, which can be designated by the issuer.

testingProcedures.description: Examine documentation to identify processes for when the PIN is not delivered to the cardholder to verify that it is deleted from the system after a fixed period of time, as designated by the issuer.
